item.description:
PHP Percolate!, our virtual self-study group is now not only for beginners. We are ready to launch PHP Percolate! Seasons 5 to cover many of the advanced topics in PHP such as:

  • Basic and Advanced Object Oriented Programming

  • Content Management Systems

  • Use of PHP Standard PHP Libraries

  • Dealing with XML Files

  • Debugging and using Unit Testing

  • The PHP Command Line Interface

  • Accessing Website Data with cCurl and Sockets

  • And much more!

For this Percolate season, we will use Larry Ullman's new book:

PHP Advanced and Object Oriented Programming

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The format of a virtual self-study group is as follows:

  • Each participant purchases the same textbook: PHP Advanced and Object Oriented Programming.
  • Each participant commits to read one chapter per week, complete the exercises and post a link to his completed work.
  • Each participant obtains assistance by posting questions to a discussion area set up on the Boston PHP Message Board for each chapter.

Note: There is no classroom instruction. There are no webcasts. There are no scheduled appointments of any kind.

How do I get started?

  • Become a member of Boston PHP, if you are not already a member.

  • Register for PHP Percolate! Season 5. Simply RSVP: Yes

  • Purchase a book (the only program cost). Simply visit the Boston PHP store and order PHP Advanced and Object Oriented Programming in one of two formats.

Full disclosure: Boston PHP Meetup receives a small commission on each sale which helps fund Meetup activities.

When your book arrives, start your virtual learning by reading one chapter at a time, completing the exercises and posting a link to your completed work.

FAQs:

Q: How long will the course last?

A: We will cover 14 chapters in the book, so 14 weeks starting December 30 and ending April 6. Refer to the PHP Percolate! Season 5 Master Discussion List for specific dates.

Q: Do I have to wait until December 30 to begin?

A: No need to wait. Feel free to begin by reading the Introduction once you obtain a copy of your book and proceed at a pace that best fits your current work/life situation.

Q: What if I have additional questions?

A: Simply post a reply below and you will receive a response.

Let's start percolating!

Tom Pettingill
Senior Percolator
